title: Master's Thesis - Small-Scale Hydrofoil Boat: Hardware Design
technologies: Servo control (Timer PWM, ADC position feedback)
overview: This project covers the embedded electronics and firmware for the small-scale hydrofoil RC boat used in my master's thesis.
The goal is to build a robust control and data-acquisition platform: read sensors, run low-level control loops, and log/stream telemetry for experiments.
The system is designed to be modular and reusable for future prototypes and testing campaigns.
highlights: Designed a custom STM32-based main control PCB (achter board and fore board) for sensor acquisition, actuator control, and power distribution.
Integrated interfaces for key sensors (IMU, TOF) and boat-specific signals (battery monitoring, current sensing).
Implemented deterministic control of actuators (ESC + servos) with safe startup and failsafe behavior.
Added telemetry output and logging to support later modelling and controller tuning.
Prepared the wiring harness and mounted the electronics inside the hull for on-water testing.
results: First revision of the custom control PCB was assembled and brought up successfully (power, programming/debug, IO validation).
Sensors and actuators were connected and verified on the bench and on water.
